alert.note: Alert for Eastern Cherry; Hooker; McPherson; Thomas; Western Cherry (Nebraska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 01 at 10:55PM CDT by NWS NorthPlatte
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of southeastern Cherry, eastern Hooker, north central McPherson and Thomas Counties through 1145 PM CDT/1045 PM MDT/... At 1055 PM CDT/955 PM MDT/, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Valentine National Wildlife Refuge to 10 miles southwest of Brownlee to 10 miles west of Mullen. Movement was southeast at 25 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Mullen, Thedford, Seneca, Brownlee, Valentine National Wildlife Refuge, Highway 83 crossing the North Loup River, Norway, Highway 97 crossing the Dismal River, Giant Hill, Natwick, Kelso, Highway 83 crossing Goose Creek and Shimmons Lake. This includes the following highways... Highway 2 between mile markers 177 and 219. Highway 97 between mile markers 38 and 74. Highway 83 between mile markers 140 and 189. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.

area.areaDesc: Eastern Cherry; Hooker; McPherson; Thomas; Western Cherry
